column5: are we sure some frustrated fisherman didn't pitch them out of the sunroof?
or their significant other.
:lol:  :lol:
Bump ...  OK.  Last chance folks.

Actually, ya might be doing the loser of the lures a favour by keeping them. If he's anything like the rest of us he blows bux trying to find the ultimate lure, and none of them ever quite live up to expectations (or advertising). He's probably thrilled to have an excuse to start all over cuz he knows that this time he'll get it right fer sure, and he won't be guilted about buying more crap cuz the other got lost. Everybody wins.  Good for you for trying though.  JF
Maybe God is not so subtly telling you to switch from fly fishing to bass/pike hunting using crankbaits?
Recently, I located a MAC laptop with DJ equiptment, est. $4000 - I checked the dudes email - called him and he came and got it. You hope that someone returns the favour one day for sure.

As I was cycling in the Guelph area this week, I found something that one of our bass fishing colleagues seems to have lost.  It appears that some equipment was blown out of the back of a truck or a boat.  In all, I recovered 56 crankbaits and spinnerbaits along with a couple of carriers.  There was no identification in the carriers, but if you can sort of identify what I have found and perhaps where I found it ...  I priced out what I found and it looks like about $400-$450 worth of gear.  Since I'm a fly fisherman I know how I'd feel at the loss.  You can contact me at sta[emailÂ protected] .   Please, only serious and honest responses.  Cheers all
its not mine, but you sure are a standup guy for trying to get it back to its owner
Thats very nice of you to do that. I bet if you loose your stuff they will do the same. Good luck
That is very admirable of you! It's nice to know there are other genuinely good people out there!
You are doing such a wonderful thing that I am not even going to carve you over being a fly fishing type. Welcome to the board! Jim
Karma Dude...karma.
Its always nice to see that there are still some decent people out there - Good on you dude for doing the right thing! .... Now go play the lottery, and share your winnings with us! .... (Karma)
Good Stuff Brother......mmmmmmmmmm..Was'nt those 200 hula poppers I lost was it??  Bushart

Let's start off by saying   "WELCOME ABOARD THE BOARD"  !!!!  Honesty and Integrity are traits that someone acquires . Hope you stick around...Good on you. If ever I lose anything of value I hope that someone like you finds it.  Can't really help you with the find.......but if there are no takers you can get an inexpensive spinning combo and start a new way of angling.  CHEERS right back to you!!  RFS
WOW, good on you!  I hope you get your good deed back 10x as you deserve it for what you are doing.  oh and welcome to the site too!
Someone out there knows someone that knows someone dude.  Hope ya find your man.  When you get your best day of fishing, post it!!  Welcome aboard!  HD
That is the ULTIMATE first post!
definately worth a bump!  Welcome and congrats!  Cheers.  K
56 crank baits. whoever lost it,must be a very serious fisherman.or he has been collecting for along time
56 lures is what falls outta my boat glove box when I open it. Don't tell my wife!
I have seen plastic boxes levitate from the floor of a bass boat and fly away... Fortunately I was checking the mirror at the time and was able to go back and get them.
is it ok if i post this on other fishing forums?
We should have a lost and found section
Hell no! I'm tryin' to collect enuf clues to convince him they're mine.  JF
yup

I've posted this on a couple of others that I know, but no honest response yet so, yes, feel free to pass it around.  But, honestly guys, enough of the accolades especially for someone you don't know.  To the fellow who suggested about Karma, thankyou and I can only hope that the good seeds watered in this life really do have a positive effect, if not in this life then perhaps the next (just so happens I am buddhist so I understand the concept fully, just don't go on too much about killing fish ... I'm mostly catch and release).  As for honesty ... well, remember no good deed goes unpunished.  I try to be honest to a fault, but even I have spent some time as a guest of Her Majesty the Queen by right of the Province of Ontario ...  By the by ... I'm giving this about a couple of weeks to resolve itself.  After that, I have a nephew that looks to score a few ... little rat even had the gall to remind about "birthdays I had missed" ... damned starving university students !!!
let us know if you find the owner! classy move friend.
Great post...thanks..a little bump up for ya here. Hope they find their way home...
It sounds as though you know the meaning of paying it forward.. Good on ya.
Welcome aboard. Great post..
